items.headline: Chess opening every chess player must know. With the incredibly popular Ruy Lopez, you can play many good chess games.
objectives_summary: The oldest and most played chess opening
How to get a solid position after few moves
Switching from the opening to the middle game and endgame

items.title: The Complete Beginner's Guide to Chess
items.headline: This course will take you from absolute chess beginner to a good intermediate level chess player
objectives_summary: Be able to appreciate the fundamentals of chess - opening, middlegame, endgame and within those the most common and important ideas
Be able to get a complete overview of the key fundamentals of chess in terms of the Opening, Middlegame and Endgame phases of the game
Be able to know basic opening traps such as the Fool's mate, Scholar's mate and many others

items.title: Chess: Beginner to Expert
items.headline: A Guide to understanding the basics of chess to a level where it becomes second nature and where mastery becomes present
objectives_summary: Play chess with a solid understanding and can now consider city wide open tournaments (beginner first)

visible_instructors.title: Paul Carrero

items.headline: Getting rid of the unconscious problems in your games
objectives_summary: Understand the ways in which your thought process influences your game
Play better games
Get more awarness of the roots of your moves

items.title: World of Chess 1: Foundation
items.headline: Chess for absolute beginners. Learn chess step-by-step.
objectives_summary: Rules of chess: board, pieces, special rules and more.
How to attack other pieces and how to defend.
How to mate with queen and rook, 2 rooks and other piece configurations.

items.title: Defensive Techniques in Chess
items.headline: Bolster your chess defense in this Chess University course by USCF Expert Ryan Murphy
objectives_summary: Students will learn how to strengthen their defensive skills when they play chess. Students will learn how to accurately spot and evaluate threats and how to respond to them in the most active way possible. Prophylactic thinking is developed as well.

items.title: Chess Strategies: How To Play Rook Endgames
items.headline: Learn how to play rook endgames including Philidor and Lucena positions! Beginners and club players are welcome!
objectives_summary: Learn how to play rook endgames
Learn what plans to apply in certain positions
Learn different motifs in rook endgames

items.title: Chess Bootcamp: Tactics
items.headline: A complete guide to chess tactics with tons of exercises.
objectives_summary: Different tactical motives
How to avoid blunders
Ideas how to improve your tactics

items.title: Bobby Fischer's most instructive games of Chess 1956-1962
items.headline: Learn about Bobby Fischer's Opening repertoire, tactics and common strategies from this period of Fischer's career
objectives_summary: Be able to see the real Beth Harmon depicted in Netflix series Queen's Gambit - Beth was largely modelled on Bobby Fischer
Be able to get more empathy for Fischer tactics and combinations
Be able to leverage Fischer's opening repertoire with 1.e4

items.title: Chess Strategies: Learn How To Checkmate
items.headline: Chess Tactics With Live Chess Examples From Real Games. Learn How To Checkmate With Only 2 Pieces! Make Them Interact!
objectives_summary: Learn checkmating patterns
Checkmate faster
Find checkmates more often during your own games

items.title: SIMPLE CHESS NOW (Chess for Beginners) 40 MINUTES TO LEARN
items.headline: I will teach you how to play Chess in 40 MINUTES
objectives_summary: How to play Chess in 40 minutes
Easily set up a Chess Board
Feel comfortable & Confident playing Chess

items.title: Mahjong Genius
items.headline: Let's Play Mahjong!
objectives_summary: The student will be able to recognize the different symbols and characters within a Mahjong set such as the “simples” tiles or suits, the “honours” tiles or winds and dragons, and the “bonus” tiles, which are the flowers.
The student will learn the proper protocol and terminologies used in the game such as “chow”, “pong”, or kong” to complete sets, and when to declare “mahjong”.

The student will learn the rules, structures, winning combinations, the value or importance of each tile and how to make strategic decisions in keeping or discarding a tile as it impacts on his/her offensive or defensive strategy.

items.title: The Complete Chess Endgame Masterclass
items.headline: Masters Your Endgame and be a professional chess player
objectives_summary: You will become master in chess endgame

items.title: Winning Moves: Secrets of Grandmaster Chess
items.headline: Think like a grandmaster and your chess results will skyrocket
objectives_summary: How to Play Chess like a Grandmaster
